properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.allowed-issuers
properties.description: Allowed issuer (iss)

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.jwk-url
properties.description: JWK Url to use for signature checking

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.print-errors-to-log
properties.description: Print warnings for wrong tokens and verification failures

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.user-federation.create-non-existing-groups
properties.description: Create non existing jwt groups in camunda

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.user-federation.create-non-existing-users
properties.description: Defines if Curo create non existing users in Camunda

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.user-federation.email-claim
properties.description: Claim which is used for email

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.user-federation.enabled
properties.description: Defines if Curo user federation is active

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.user-federation.first-name-claim
properties.description: Claim which is used for firstname

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.user-federation.group-claim
properties.description: Claim which is used for groups if loadGroupFromRoles is disabled

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.user-federation.last-name-claim
properties.description: Claim which is used for lastname

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.user-federation.load-group-from-roles
properties.description: Defines if Curo map roles to groups. If not, Curo will use the groupClaim to load a list of groups

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.user-federation.print-non-existing-groups
properties.description: Defines if Curo should log non existing jwt groups

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.user-federation.resource-access-claim
properties.description: Claim which is used for resource access

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.user-federation.resource-name
properties.description: Defines the resource from the the roles are used if loadGroupFromRoles is enabled

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.user-federation.revoke-camunda-admin-group
properties.description: Revoke the camunda-admin group from users even if they don't have this group in their JWT

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.user-id-claim
properties.description: Claim which is used to check against Camunda (user id) Common claims: email, preferred_username

properties.name: curo.auth.oauth2.verify-jwt
properties.description: Should Curo check the signature against the defined public key

properties.name: curo.auth.type
properties.description: Type of authentication supported by Curo: basic, oauth2

properties.name: curo.camunda-group-id-pattern
properties.description: Shortcut for camunda.bpm.generic-properties.properties.groupResourceWhitelistPattern *Recommended pattern: '[a-zA-Z0-9-.@_]+'*

properties.name: curo.camunda-telemetry
properties.description: If set, Curo will define the camunda telemetry to that value

properties.name: curo.camunda-user-id-pattern
properties.description: Shortcut for camunda.bpm.generic-properties.properties.userResourceWhitelistPattern *If email is used for id please use this pattern: '[a-zA-Z0-9-.@_]+'*

properties.name: curo.create-initial-filters
properties.description: Defines if Curo creates filter during startup.

properties.name: curo.flow-to-next.default-timeout
properties.description: Default timeout in seconds for flowToNext requests Default: 30s

properties.name: curo.flow-to-next.ignore-assignee
properties.description: Should Curo ignore the assignee for flowToNext requests Default: false

properties.name: curo.flow-to-next.interval
properties.description: How long in milliseconds should Curo wait between requests to Camunda if flowToNext got requested Default: 500ms

properties.name: curo.ignore-object-type
properties.description: If active, Curo will override object variables with json value if the new value does not match the object type of the variable.

properties.name: curo.initial-filter-location
properties.description: Location in which Curo searches for initial filter json files.

properties.name: curo.initial-groups
properties.description: Define groups which Curo should create on startup. If group already exists, Curo will not create it again.

properties.name: curo.initial-users
properties.description: Define users which Curo should create on startup. If the user already exists, only the groups are assigned.

properties.name: curo.print-stacktrace
properties.description: Should Curo print stacktraces to the log and rest responses

properties.name: curo.set-default-serialization-format
properties.description: If set, Curo will override the default serialization format to application/json
